text: Please be aware this is a take out joint with common tables shared with other take out places. We came for breakfast at 10 am their opening time. They did not have masala for the dosa nor several other items. Two employees had just opened the place. Not professionally run place. Took half an hour to get the food. The plain dosa by then was cold. Not a good experience altogether.

If you want to try one of the worlds horrible restaurant then do try this. Don't believe in the comments which people have given below and order the food . I was totally mislead looking at the review and comments . Especially do not order to go because you will starve waiting for the food to be delivered!!!!

Ordered 4 cup of tea, its been 45 min and still waiting. They don't know what customer service is. Even dinner at restaurant don't take that long!! 
Avoid this place at any cost!!
Food is good...  Few options...  Even that doesn't available at times..  Went thrice for veg biriyani, it was not available any time...
food was really good, good amount of spice. the price was a bit much for the portion they gave. but employees were friendly and food was ready fast.

This restaurant was awesome! Great food! We asked a few people who worked at other restaurants and they had no clue. We walked in through the main lobby at the Venetian and once we made it to the palazzo we used the escalators to reach the second floor. Finally sound this gem after meandering through the maze of corridors.
I found this place later in the night so I wasn't hungry, but I wanted a treat. I purchased a mango lassi and it was a nice size. Creamy and delicious! I will be eating there someday soon.

The perfect location - if you are on strip or in venetian and want to eat indian food, this is the spot! Food taste, price, quantity and service - all very reasonable! We would recommend this for indian food.

Tasty chicken curry, raita and very adequate portion. Doesn't taste like fast food, more like home cooking(if we could match the spices!) Good value, especially for being so near the Strip but not east to find.
Awesome taste and perfect location. The servings are sufficient and is authentic Indian styled spicy food.

Cute little spot in the Grand Canal Shoppes - authentic Indian food with great flavor, good quantity and decent price. They even have Limca, Thumbs Up, and Mazaa. Highly recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala, the Chicken Korma, and their uttapam. They even have traditional Indian "chai" which we loved. 

Took a star away because both days we went, one of the items we wanted happened to be out/unavailable.

We ordered paneer tikka masala. 
1. Rude owner.
2. Horrible food.
3. Deceptive pictures.
4. Horrible service. They won't listen to you about your order. 
5. DO NOT order tea. It's watery, super spicy (even by Indian standards).

This is a great find. We were here for lunch and had the Kukad Wrap, Paneer Tikka Sandwich with Apple Chutney and Masala Chips, and Chicken Curry. Portions are large and come with Naan Bread, Rice, and Salad. We enjoyed it. The staff is pleasant and mentioned they will be going 24 hours soon. They just opened. Good luck guys.

I'm pretty new with Indian food, but this was really delicious. It came out pretty fast, and the portions were big. I'm in love with naan! I work on the strip so I will probably be going back there again on my lunch break.

This place is amazing.  The food is delicious. People are friendly and they have  good service. I never miss the opportunity to eat there whenever I'm in the strip. Come and try it. You'll never regret it.
we r crazy abt ur pau vhaji ... we love ur dal makhani we come here every week ...if u r hungry n craving abt indian food u should try this place ..

We wanted to eat Indian veg food in the night on the strip. We ordered Pav Bhaji and Dal Makhani. The food was ok, too much butter for my liking but OK. Worth going to if oyu are hungry and craving for food in the middle of your gambling.

If you are looking for some place that has good Indian food and not pricy ...this place is perfect for you...it's less spicy than usual that we Indians are used to. That's would be my only complaint. 
But parathas are superb. Biryani is amazing too !

Food is neatly packed in to-go boxes, very well presented.

I will visit it atleast once every time I visit vegas.

It was actually super tasty, and not badly priced. I am giving four stars because the location was decent, the staff friendly, but I didn't like how the place had run out of some condiments. Oh well. 
Good food, plenty of space in the dining area to sit down. They have thumbs up!! That's my favorite soda.

I wish I can give a negative number. It is that bad.  I got on the waiting line thinking the line will move. No, the line literally does not move for a long time. Despite the long waiting line, the cashier is extremely slow, takes all the time she wants and has this "I don't care" attitude.  I waited almost an hour to finally arrive at the cashier. Then I noticed there's a second long waiting line where you pick up the food. So I asked what's that other line for? Then she rudely tells me there's additional 30 min waiting for food to be prepared. I thought this was  fast food.  After waiting almost an hour to order the food, I decided I cannot wait another 30 minutes. Besides, there's no guarantee that food will be ready in 30min. I could be there for additional hour.  I couldn't trust these slow incompetent, ruthless people. I also didn't want to be late for a show. So I just left without ordering. I don't know how good the food is, but I was totally disgusted with their rude mannerism and inefficient business practice.  The worst food court experience ever!!!!

Excellent food,  tried chicken masala, late in the evening. The gravy was good and tender pieces of chicken.  The cashier was friendly and knowledgeable about the food and made good recommendations.  The place looked clean and sanitary.

Not sure if any one can guess the picture attached is actually not plain rice but 'vegetable biryani'. Ordered online and got one of the worst biryanis I have ever had. The rice was bad, veggies hidden deep below rice was way over cooked and tasted bad. Restaurant had no courtesy to pack plastic ware and napkins for a delivery order that too when they know their consumer base is largely travelers and not locals. 
Overall - waste of money. At least the dish I ordered.

Tasty sandwiches and the chicken curry was good. Mango Lassi was thick. Hot fresh food. Only suggestion I have is for the tandoori chicken to be less cooked, ours was dry. But definitely a place I would go to again. It hits the craving of wanting something different and spicy In a food court.

First of all happy to find an Indian joint in the strip. Secondly the food was authentic Indian food. Obviously caters to Indian palate. We were there on New year's day, they were overwhelmed and food took very long. Had dosa the first time, It was good. The next day had Pav Bhaji for breakfast with chai. They were in better control that day, I guess the kitchen staff were back at work. Yummy, spicy- Authentic!!

Its good that there is an Indian joint in the casino which holds the most conferences and more options for vegetarian people. 

For me personally - the indian tea , its not great but is better than dip dip tea with no taste, you get in other tea and coffee shops for double price.  

Most of the time I have only tea at this place which is also just okay. Its inconsistent and they don't keep brown sugar so I usually carry my own. 
I did try a few things here like masala dosa and papri chat. It feels like they server pre-made frozen stuff diluted as the species are less, salt is missing and everything is quiet tasteless. 
They used chole gravy instead of tamarind chutney in papri chat - who does that ? 
Dosa without salt, i had to use hot sauce to spice up otherwise it was unpalatable. 

I will still go back there for tea for lack of choice else where but i am done with eating any of their food. 
Service is pretty slow too. 
They need to have separate line for tea.

Visited late last night after a show. The guy at the counter was not fit to work in any hospitality field. He was rude and condescending. I don't know what he is doing in a Indian restaurant?I don't think even McDonald's will hire him. I will never go back to this lousy place. I ate in lots of other great Indian places in Las Vegas as I am a frequent visitor of this city.  I hope the management notice this review and TakeCare of there customer service and treat customers with respect and make them feel welcomed.

Better Indian restaurants to eat in Las Vegas than this one. Not worthy to eat nor tasteless food. Sambhar is equal to water and Shahi paneer is paneer in tomato sauce. Naan and idli were not freshly made. They were preheated.

Guy at register ignored me until I asked if they were open. He then failed to say thank you when I paid, just silently handed me the receipt. With dozens of other food options within 50 feet, it seems this place would make an effort to welcome customers. Vegetable biryani was decent, and very spicy, but I knocked off a star because I cannot stand rudeness like that!

Nothing authentic. Bad food . We asked for tikka sandwich and we got a different order. Not sure if chef knows the difference of tikka . Please don't go by the snap shots on the display. Food is no never close to Indian food

Late night (nothing else was open at 1am) meal ruined because Aman placed order for wrong meal even after I repeated 3 times that I wanted something else and he wouldn't exchange the order, insisting that I ordered chicken even though I'm a vegan. Ridiculous and argumentative man gave me indigestion. Blachhh...

I liked this place and will recommend it vegetarian food, esp for folks who are missing Indian food

Got the masala dosa which was good, but Samabar and chatni can be improved a lot, minimally should not be cold chatni 

The shaai paneer was sweet and the rice was undercooked. Room to improve but deneitly good enough to quench the thirst for Indian food

Hidden little gem in the food court of the Grand Canal Shoppes. Perfect place to eat a good flavorful spicy bite after roaming around and after some good drinks ! It claims to be open 24X7 , however beware - they were closed for 30 mins between 5 - 5:30 am (luckily we got there at 4:45 am). The food does not come out that fast - so thats a negative, but it was probably 5-6 mins longer wait than rest of the places in the food courts. Then why the 4 stars? : for 4 main things:

- good Indian food right on the Vegas strip 
- serving Thumbs Up 
- Yummy salted lassi 
AND THE BEST OF ALL -  amazing PAV BHAJI... the taste was so authentic. It was low on salt - so all the flavors did not shine through, but once that was fixed - which is an easy fix - it was superb.

We also tried the paid chat and the chana masala - and they were strictly ok. 

Go for the PAV BHAJI - you will not be disappointed !

This was my third visit. This time I ordered the masala dosa and loved it. The crepe looks huge but crepe skin is just folded over. Still, there's a decent amount of potato filling inside. It comes with a small cup of delicious spicy vegetable soup. My only complaint is that I had to wait a while because the dosa was very popular and it looked like the griddle could only handle two orders at a time. But I'll be back and next time I go earlier to beat the crowd.

I'm pretty familiar with Indian food and I have to admit this place was pretty on point. We tried the wraps and sandwiches and both were finger licking good! I love the idea of Indian wraps and sandwiches which is different and the best part is it was easier to eat than most traditional Indian food. They had some great dessert choices as well that we just couldn't pass up on. The staff was very pleasant and friendly. I'll definitely be stopping by again.

I really liked this place; the dishes were authentic and freshly prepared.  The naan bread was to die for!!  I had the chicken tikka masala and my friend had the lamb. Both were really flavorful and not too spicy, but just right!  I'm glad we stumbled upon this little gem hidden in the food court!

Worst food I ever had.. looks like they serve frozen and rotten food. It's in Venetia food court, so we went there. We ordered thali, idali, mango lassi, paneer sandwich. All items were bad in taste and quality

Curry Pot is conveniently located in the Venetian but the food quality is below average. We ordered a veg thali and got a naan, rice and daal with side of salad. The naan tasted like it was frozen. You can get much better Indian food at India Masala which I just left a review for. Be prepared to wait about 20 mins to get the food.

Came across Curry Pot in the food court. Worst decision ever to eat chicken here. Do not recommend & will not return. Got Malai Chicken Tikka which looked good and presentable but tasted God awfulChicken was super dry for being a dry chicken. 
Also, was hard and dried looking on the outside. These guys need to learn how to cook. That's horrible to be preparing food like this! What a waste of money!
Very disappointedSee my Yelp pictures for evidence of dryness in the chicken.

Great place for actually authentic tasting Indian food. I got the pav bhaji, and they even made it indian spicy for me. Although it didn't taste as good as home or India it was a good substitute. Friend got chicken Tikka sandwich and loved it also!

Plus they have maaza and frooti :)

Horrible! Horrible experience. Endless hours of waiting and orders were served in ridiculous order. Our family with one child ended up hungry for over forty minutes. Ended up eating else where twice. I don't know why this useless place has raving reviews. There are enough Indian restaurants on the strip now that serve just as good food. Who needs these arrogant, condescending and ignorant place that stands for nothing Indian. Begining  with respecting a hungry guest. Shame on curry pot. Never ever going here. Someday you will face the consequences of your actions....All that flies high will fall! Review from a hungry disappointed guest.

I could have given 0 stars if possible. Dosa had no salt in it and when asked about it, we get a casual response saying 'people prefer less salt'!
Masala chai was such a waste. I would definitely not recommend anyone to this place.

Great little Indian outlet inside Venetian. Chicken tikka masala was delicious!

Mango lassi was good too.

high quality fresh indian food at good price. I got the spinach and cheese and asked to substitute the bread and rice for something else. He gave me chickpeas! I basically got both superb dishes for the price of one ($15)! Don't let the food court exterior steer you away. This place is restaurant quality food without the fluff and expense.

It took around 45 mins to order and it's been 1 hour and we are still waiting for the order in addition to that we are rewarded with a rude and shouting behaviour . And they are still taking the orders with not even mentioning the estimated time to give the food.


Please don't visit this place until they are sure about your order

Visited on Christmas Eve, there was a long queue. After waiting for half hour in queue and half hour for food, the food was having very low quality. I must say they degraded quality of food because of crowd. I ordered paneer tikka sandwich and i taste only bread, they spoiled my evening. Never revisit this place.

First time going to the Venetian's food court and I selected this spot.  I haven't had Indian food in a long time.  I saw a lot of Indian people eating near this spot so I figured it had to be good.  The female order taker was very friendly and greeted me.  I ordered the butter chicken & the chai tea.  I waited about 20 mins.  They had 1 cook back there and he was turning the food out.  I finally received food and it was worth the wait.  You don't get a lot it u get just enough.  The butter chicken had flavor, tasted authentic us the rice.  The naan bread was warm.  The chai tea tasted different from what I was used to.  It had some other herbs in there which I loved.  I like this spot.  Very cool, reasonable price, clean countertop.

I wish I had an option of giving 0 star. To start with, the service is pathetic. We had ordered a bottle of water along with plethora of dishes. The wait time on food was 30 mins which is understandable given the holiday rush. However, we Requested them to give us the water while we waited for food but they refused to give it . & refused very rudely. 
I'm highly disappointed. 
Couldn't even wait for the food to review this place. 
I'm not suggesting it to anyone for sure!

Not so good, if you are from India, you need to think twice about trying this place. Not trying to bash this place but it all seems pretty premise with the most. Basic flavors, let alone the "authentic Indian". Only good thing is they are open 24/7 however the quality lacks a lot of good indian flavors and spiciness that is a basic requirement with our somewhat traditional food. Service is not nearly up to par. Not looking forward to come back.. Good luck if you went to give this place any business specially its nearly $15 per person and I came with a party of 7. And none of us seemed to enjoy our food.. that's six different plates.. money not well spent unfortunately

My boss was really wary of my choice of a place to eat after my last two choices, when I was travelling with him in Dallas, were a total bust. And I chose those based on yelp reviews. So when I chose this again based on yelp, he decided we eat at the falafel joint in the food court. The food there was not nice. I however wanted to give curry pot a go so I came back later in the evening. I was pleasantly surprised to find really good pav bhaaji. It was authentic. The chat masala in the salad , butter melting in the bhaji and salted butter for the buns. This guy knew what he was doing. I can just say this, when in Dallas don't trust yelp since Dallas yelpers don't know what they are saying but other than that yelp has not failed me. This is a 4.5 star for taste. Esp for pav bhaaji since that's the dish I had. Portion size was good.
Salt lassi is great.... dosa though not as good as home made, is still passable for a Vegas joint...

Chicken Tikka sandwich sounded amazing but wasn't. It was around $9- the filling was tasty with paneer cheese and a rich sauce. But the bread was bad- little piece of cheap wheat bread? I totally thought it would be naan or something heartier. Took a long time when I was the only customer. Definitely a pass or I would get a curry pot

Four stars for a fast food joint in a food court. Not bad at all. Loved the flavors. Definitely different than any other Tandoori chicken that I've had. The chaat masala on the salad was an awesome touch. My wife loved her uttapam. She said that the chutney that came with the uttapam was off the hook.

I would give this place 5 stars if it weren't for how long I waited for my food. It was at least 30 minutes if not more before I got my food. I wouldn't mind waiting that long at a sit down place but a food court should be wayyyyy faster. The food itself was delicious. I got Chana masala and it was the best I've had. The naan was delicious and soft, with a buttery taste. Food was great but if you're in a hurry definitely skip this place.
Excellent food!!!!! Masala Dosa is legit!!!  Don't believe the other reviews... this is so good, flavors are on point and just spicy enough!

Just got back from a fun weekend in Vegas. My wife keep telling me she wanted curry and I had no idea what place would have it on the strip.  We went to lunch at the food court and just happened to find this shop. Good food and a good price.

This place is located in the canal shops food court between the Palazzo and the Venetian. In an area of the strip where you will pay for almost anything (including oxygen at a bar), you will get a reasonable and flavorful meal here. You know it's good when the line wraps around the neighboring stall.
Very nice to see indian food place inside Venetian. Pav baji is good. Biryani is not good, its just basmati rice with some curry, no biryani spices at all.
Very tasty food. Vegetable biryani was amazing. Very light and flavorful. Dosa and Sambhar was good too.

Good indian food. We ordered uthapam and idli which were very good. Sambar and coconut chutney were authentic. We also ordered paneer tikka sandwich and paneer wrap which were disappointing. The sandwich did not have paneer tikka but paneer bhurgee and nothing else. Both the name and picture are misleading.
The food was just OK. Finding the restaurant was a catch, it is inside "The Venetian" on Level 2  , food court. I called them three times before i reached they never gave me clear directions.
Food was reasonable but the wait time and service was terrible. I would not repeat. If the place is not crowded and you are craving Indian, you can give it a try. Mediocre overall.

Really good Indian food.  Can adjust meals to be vegan upon request.  Don't go with the sandwiches. They are only ok.  Chips are stale.  However, the chicken tikka and paneer are great.  Prices are a little high for food court but it's the striiiiiiieeeeeeep!
Nice to go indian place in Venetian. Biryani was okay but the daal makhini and chole were awesome. Definitely worth trying if you want to eat something bear the strip

Indian food court food is a bit of a hit or miss. I have to classify this shop as a miss. I waited about 15 minutes for the food which is a bit long for food court food. Also, it was about $13 but I guess that's the nature of Las Vegas food.

I got the palak paneer (spinach) and thought it was quite bland. The salad also consisted of mostly raw onions and a lime. I added some salt to the main entree and it improved it very slightly. The naan was not bad though, although it didn't really taste like traditional naan. It was more like pita.

Inside the Venetitian are many fancy restaurants but I was in a mood for South Indian food and Curry Pot is the only option here. I was really skeptical - I am from Chennai and ordering masala dosa inside a casino that has Italian theme is the biggest gamble I can make. I was not that lucky with the slots but this gamble paid off. The Masala dosa was beyond palatable, it was yummy.  Their masala tea was good too. It had perfect spicing and sugar. 

Try this place. I took one star out because no matter how good this dosa is... It does not compare to A2B and their likes

I know, what was I thinking? Indian food in a mall food court no less. But, I took a chance and thought it would be a hidden gem. Unfortunately, this experience left much to be desired. Not only was the butter chicken sauce really tangy for my tastes but it was actually cold (!) in the middle of the dish. I have no idea how part of it could be cold when another outer part was hot. And because I waited about 8 mins with a beeper for my food to be prepared. That was a huge turn-off on top of an already unappetizing meal.
Really good taste. Reasonable price for the strip. Papdi Chaat (with the mangoes) was an interesting spin on the original dish. Salt lassi was refreshing. Enjoyed it !!

A nice small spot inside the Venetian. The food was exquisite. They have a lot of options, mostly reasonably priced. South Indian and North Indian food in decent portions. The food was really fresh and freshly prepared. I would definitely recommend for tourists wanting a quick Indian bite.

Staying at the Palazzo, I'm picky about restaurants, in fact I walked out of Yardbirds bcos I was looking for light and flavorful and not deep fried chicken n biscuits .  I was really impressed that a food court in the Venetian has good quality Indian food. Chicken tikka masala was just right, not too spicy and the tandoori chicken was superbly roasted but very juicy. Paneer tikka sandwich was lightly seasoned shredded paneer and cheese on Texas toast. Washed it down with a tasty Mango lassi 

Lol, writing this review after coming back the very next night, what can I say, the place is good!!!!
Was having a rough day with the kids and wow this lamb curry lifted my spirits!  I give it a four star but as far as food court food goes this is definitely five star.

Among all the options in the strip, this place serves decent food. Although its 24x7, co called decent food is served only during BF, Lunch and dinner timing. I was in Vegas for five days and I eat here almost everyday.     One fine day it was 12:00 am then I remembered these guys are open,  I ordered Papidi chaat, I didn't expect them prepare right then, but I also dint expect them to serve papdi chaat "chilled". The guy at the cash register says, that's how papdi chaat is made. 
All I would say is, as there are no better options, it's a wise thing to avoid this restaurant, after dinner time.

Overall the food was good. I would say above average considering how Indian food can become nasty if not cooked fresh. 

Shahi Paneer, Chana, Lamb Curry were awesome. 

Veg Biryani could be better..

Please consider compostable container over plastic as it looks cheap and dangerous.

Decent food, not bad for a Vegas spot. Not amazing not bad either. We enjoyed our food that we got. It was definitely pricey for the amount of food that we got. It's good if you're in a hurry. Probably better options out there for Indian cuisine.

We were 8 people and ordered variety of food like Masala Dosa, Idli, Uttapam, Chana Masala, chicken biryani. None of us liked what they ate. It's not superbad, but it's not what you expect from Indian food.

You should eat here if you absolutely have have to eat Indian food. super slow service,  cold/stale food and found it to be expensive too. (tamba restaurant is on the stripe and we spent less there for a real meal)
11/25/2016. Came her for lunch, with my wife. Everything we tried was delicious. Wife lived, o I mean loved papdi chat.

Worst Indian food I have ever had. We ordered dosas and idlis for breakfast, both were stale and had no salt whatsoever. Sambar was too spicy. Big disappointment! Expect to wait in line forever as they only have 1 cook. Plus, the prices are way too high.

After reading several negatives, was skeptical trying this place out. So glad I did. Got here around 9am as not many other options that early. Breakfast paratha special, masala dosa, idli, pao bhaji everything was great. Service was quick. Amira was super friendly. 

And their masala chai is a must have!!!
Food was good. I ordered Chicken Tiki Masala. Just the right amount of food for my husband and me.
random unexpected indian food court spot with chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo meals -- not hold back on the spice which is nice for the vindaloo

Not a ton of vegetarian friendly options on the strip so the Curry Pot was a welcome find. Had a paneer sandwich which wasn't horribly overpriced ($9) compared to similar sized meals on the strip. My wife had a curry bowl that was just ok, but for what we needed this place was perfect. Veg friendly!

I ordered the Masala Dosa! I thought it was very good!!! The dosa tasted very good and was huge!!! The potato filling was very good as well including the dal! For a fast food Indian place inside a food court I thought it was very tasty and would go back!!!

1. Did not take our complete order. Missed one persons dish completely.
2. Loooooong wait time.
3. This is what I call timepass indian food... if u r not 'craving' india food, skip this place.

solid fast food, but nothing special. i'm also spoiled because the Bay Area has amazing Indian food. I had the chicken tikka masala, which was recommended by the young man at the cash register --  it was fine. If you're hungover and need something quick, this place will satiate your needs, but don't expect to be blown away.
Great food and super helpful since its open 24/7..Can be a great option when you have that late night hunger strike!!

We were very disappointed with the food here. If I can give zero stars I would. 

We ordered idli and dosa at 10am. It turns out it was just reheated food from yesterday as they hadn't gotten their delivery for the morning. 

I am not sure if the food will taste any better but we got stale and not so tasty food.

Like the food a lot and the employees are friendly. The only bummer is that if you leave a tip on card, the employees don't receive it. That is hopefully a kink they're working out, if not it is deceptive. I think the sandwiches are a better deal than the curry pots. Give it a try.

Wait for over half an hour before canceling my order. Only ordered 1 dish and 4 other people after me got their food first. Asked them after 30 min when food was coming out and they said five min. Waited another 10 min before I gave up

While at the Venetian I decided to try out this Indian restaurant. First impressions OMG yess!!!!! Actually very well priced. Then I walked up to order and the server was very crabby. Not at all friendly then I waited about 7 minutes and my "butter chicken" was brought out in this tiny to go container??? Terrible customer service when I asked for a cup of water and they declined. Telling me I needed to purchase a bottle? Like I clearly see your vending area and it has an option for water? 

I advise you to some place else. "Lovepreet" was the name of the guy behind the register and the guy who brought out my food. Terrible terrible terrible
This review is for their paneer wrap. It's probably the worst wrap --- Indian or otherwise that I may have ever had. Couldn't get through it and had to go to chipotle to order another meal.
24 hours indian food joint. Loved their paneer sandwich, dal makhani & chana masala along with aloo paratha. Very Fresh.
Very nice to see this indian place in the midst of the venetian . Clean and neat place . Good tasty food . We tried the sandwich and dosa

I'll start with customer service! - Really bad - I had food twice here. The next day, the food tasted stale and also was spicy. The owner clearly denied that it was stale, and the spice was mild! I mean is the customer stupid to say such things. Nonetheless, it wasn't great food either. Just edible enough.

Second, they charge (whatsoever the low charge is), for some extra sauces (coconut chatni). Its like i get charged for asking for ketchup with my burgers and sandwiches!

I had the lamb vindaloo and my wife had the butter chicken. Definitely a spice kick but I love spicy. Portions were great and the food was well seasoned and fresh! Took little less than ten minutes to get our order. Definitely a hidden Gem in the food court of processed food

I cannot thank this place enough for saving my 3 O'clock cravings...had been here in pajamas to get my food....i love love love the tandoori chicken, daal makhani and the cute little naan...has always eaten here like a monster...the food is really yummy..you get rice along with a side of lemons and onions...nothing can go wrong in here..even the people in front are really good...

Let me first say I love Indian food & my daughter's tennis coach is from Punjabi so we know good Indian...this is legit. I had the chicken tikka & my husband ordered the potato dosa. We ended up sharing each others meals bc it was so delicious. I will return to this location for sure on our next visit to Vegas. What a find that we literally just stumbled upon. Keep up the good work Curry Pot.

Dal is really good. We ordered a la carte. Shahi paneer was frozen as I suspected from a fast food place. Naans were good. 
Staff friendly. Called them twice and they helped me with directions.

if you're craving Indian food later in the night at a place like Vegas this might be your best bet.
Curry pot is tucked in a cozy corner of the food court at the Venetian.During many of our visits i have tried the Chicken curry, chicken korma, chicken tikka masala, chicken biryani, malai tikka (most things on the menu).
The curry combos are served with a small portion of rice,naan and salad priced at about $12 which is quite reasonable.The curries were surprisingly fresh and homey.

The wait wasn't bad either.They serve indian juices like maaza, thums up,frooti etc.I would give the Biryani and kababs a miss.

Food is 3 stars but they deserve extra credit for being open 24 hours.

Cheers!

Great addition to the food court at the Venetian. Menu is good, and will hit the spot if you are craving Indian and happen to be nearby. But not a place you would make a trip too. I had the Chicken Tikki Masala. The flavor was there, but the chicken breast was the driest I've ever had in this dish. It was white meat but it was dark in color and way too dry. Lead me to believe it is old or just really over cooked. I would probably give it another shot but it's nothing to write home about.

Eaten here every time I'm in Vegas and have never been disappointed as far as quality of food goes. Love the little side salad they give you with lemon, onions, and green chili. That is a very staple Indian side "dish" to have.

I will say the service is hit or miss. I've waited for about 20 min and there was no one ahead of me or I've waited under 5 minutes.

A pretty ordinary Indian curry spot at the food court at the Canal Shoppes.  Nothing bad but nothing special either.  They do cater to both vegetarians and normal (meat) meals. The best selling point is their convenience.
Delicious food, friendly staff. Love it! We are coming here once a week and it's always so delicious and a big variety of food for vegetarians. Prices are very fair, portions are perfect.

I was pleasantly surprised to find a fast food curry restaurant in a food court. It smelled really good when I approached, so I thought I would give it a try. I had the chicken korma and it was deliciously spicy. It came with rice and naan bread, both very tasty and freshly prepared. I was surprised at the spice level of the chicken, considering I did not specify. But if you like Indian food, it was definitely the right spice level. I think this is the best food offered here in this food court!
Totally loved this place! Generous portions, flavorful dishes, the girls at the front were very friendly and helpful. My curry chicken was delish!!I'll definitely come back.

The food was suprisingly good. We had the biryani, sahi panner and the indian chai. All of them were very authentic and left us satisifed. Also, for the curries they let you swap the salad or rice for extra naan.

First off, Indian food inside of a hotel? All you have to do is to go down to the food court and order them. I love the idea already. 

This Indian food place located inside of the Venetian hotel, which is a very nice hotel. 

My husband ordered chicken curry for me one night and asked the cook to make the curry spicier. They did a good job . The curry was really tasty and the portion was fare for the price they charged. 

I went back the next day for dinner and i was very happy that I did not have to get in a car and drive for a good Indian food while in Vegas.

Food court quality Indian food. The flavors were good but the chicken curry and chicken tikka masala weren't as "smooth and creamy" as I've had at most Indian restaurants.  Price was slightly higher than expected for a food court - but then again it is at the Venetian.  Not bad for a quick bite if you're in the mood for Indian and don't have much time.  Just temper expectations a bit. Probably better than most of the other restaurants in the food court, but still food court quality for sure. Decent but not remarkable.
Enough said... destroyed the chicken tick sand which and pavphaji... delicious convenient and really good. Very comparable to my favorite place in  California.

This is NOT fast service! Do not eat here! ! I waited 25mins for a plain dosa. Not sure why a dosa takes so long. Someone else ordered a curry after me and was served in 5 mins. Very poor customer service and not enough workers. Eat at another restaurant where the line is longer and you will still be served faster! Too bad that they don't have a better operation as there isn't another Indian food vendor in the food court!

We were super happy to see an Indian restaurant right with in the Venetian food court and tried it multiple times during the last 3 days .. the staff were good and the prices were not bad for the location.. which gives it the first 2 stars ... the taste was ok for some( parantha,sambar,lassi) bad for some  ( dosa, biriyani uthappa, chai) so would have got another half but the kicker for us was .. 2 of my family members have felt minor food poisoning- vomited everything they ate in the afternoon) so cutting the next 3. 

For the location .. if they do a good job with food they would be killing it in there. Overall sorry ... disappointed.

Finding a good Indian restaurant is always not easy. But curry pot has reached top stars ..let it be in food quality or be it in taste. We had been there 4 times in a row in 2 days..it dint disappoint us at all. The food is served really hot and perfect portion size too. Thank you curry pot!!

I guess we're in the minority when it comes to this place. We don't have a lot of experience with Indian food so can't speak to this restaurants authenticity. So we will judge by taste and value. Talking about value when you're in Vegas is an oxymoron. It's like finding a unicorn. Value wise this place is not. You don't get much food for what you pay. Taste wise the food was just mediocre. We wouldn't go back here again.

This place is hidden in an obscure food court so you'll have to make a bit of a trek to find it. Trust me it's worth the walk. Nothing fancy in fact it's just a food court place but they have excellent Indian food with a bit of a kick and large portions. I'll come back here if I'm back in town and in the mood for Indian food.

Not good a quality one. Pav bhaji is pretty cold.
When ask , they said they were remaking it, but they just microwaved it and gave back it to me. And idli was not also fresh and it's like a stone.
Horrific wait. Took 3x longer than estimate and ended up giving up on the food when they were non-responsive over phone. Avoid this place...

I've never had Indian fast food before, but I'm guessing curry pot is a chain. Their menu is at least varied, with vegetarian and meat options for all. I ended up ordering the shahi paneer because I like a good paneer, although I have never had shahi before. 
It came out steaming in a small plastic container, so I could take it back to my place if I really wanted to. It was served with naan, a side of masala sprinkled vegetables, including onion, cucumber, and tomato, rice, and the curry. 
The rice was steaming. The naan was fresh. The vegetables confused me until I dipped a piece into the curry. Then I saw a huge flaw. 
The curry was cold. 
Not cold cold but room temperature. Eating the shahi paneer with naan and rice disguised it, but dipping in a piece of onion confirmed it. The curry was cold. 
Don't serve cold curry, guys. It's the end of December. Please keep me healthy. Thanks.

This place is located in the food court inside the Venetian.  Its ok.  I had the chicken tikka masala and it had plenty of chicken but dry.  Sauce was grainy and wouldn't even stick to the rice.  A lot of Indians eating here so maybe they know what to order but my meal was meh.  To go was boxed well.  $13 wasn't worth it.

The Grand Canal Shoppes food court is somewhat always in a state of flux. The No1DP and I visit the Shoppes at least ever year for the last four years (partly because we end up staying at the Palazzo for his conference) and while we can count on staples such as Johnny Rockets, Subway and Wasabi Jane there's always one or two new business that open up that replaced the businesses that closed. Curry Pot was a new addition for this year.

Their slogan is "American made, authentically Indian". While I haven't eaten at enough Indian restaurants to make informed decisions about its authenticity what the No1DP and I can tell you that this was one of the better Indian places we tried. No1DP's also picky about his Indian food as he can get a good plate back in Japan. He was initially hesitant about my choice because his stomach doesn't go well with bad Indian food but I had a good gut feel about this place. Considering the affluent environment of the Venetian|Palazzo complex it has to cater to a wide range of ethnicities. The menu options are more limited than traditional Indian curry houses but what's unique about this particular Indian joint is their limited South Indian options. Normally traditional curry houses are staffed by people from the northern part of India so you wouldn't see masala dosa served here.

CURRY POTS: Served with cumin-saffron basmati rice, naan bread, salad.
- Chicken Tikka Masala (Chicken, Creamy Tomato Sauce, Red Chili Paste, Herbs & Spices)
- Classic Chicken Curry (Chicken, Onion-Tomato Sauce, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Herbs & Spices, $12)

No1DP got the tikka masala while I got their classic curry chicken. As mentioned we enjoyed our plates because not only was it delicious but it was also one of the healthier options in the food court. We noted that the curries were at least moderately spicy (which we didn't mind as we're used to moderately spicy) - we didn't specify spice levels and we don't know whether this could be adjusted for people who can't tolerate spicy food. Portions were quite big for a curry dish as there was a generous amount of chicken and a good amount of sauce for the "naan". We could have ended up sharing a curry pot and it would've been adequate for lunch.

We did note a few concerns with our dishes:
- The "naan" that was served was actually pita cooked in the style of naan. Though it was still a good bread and went well with the curry sauce, the business does advertise themselves as "authentically Indian". I would think Indians would have an issue with this.
- The salad contains too much onions. Needs more greens. I didn't mind this as much as I love onions with my curry and it was sprinkled with cumin.
- The No1DP ate one of the peppers and it was enough for him to be bothered by it for at least 5 minutes. As he's somewhat lactose intolerant mango lassi was out of the question and had to get rid of the lingering spice with beer. Upon inspection I noticed there was quite a bit of green pepper seeds in the salad. Again I like my spice so this wasn't much of an issue but I don't know how a person with a lower tolerance of spice would handle it.

Even with mild concerns the No1DP and I would come back here for a quick lunch should we be in the area. Hopefully this place does well enough so we could come back here again next year. I was bummed that I couldn't go back to Anchor Bar (last year's food court lunch), so I hope tourists will be more open-minded to try food court Indian.
AMAZING Behl puri & butter chicken! Prices are reasonable for a casino. Wish they had INDIAN hot sauce instead of packets of Tapatio?!?!?
Decent food with good quality. Surprisingly chicken biriyani tasted really good . Give it a try if ur craving Indian food.
Best effing idli sambhar in town.  You would never expect this quality inn a food court.
Chicken tikka masala wqs more like chicken with tomato sauce and salad was mostly onions (not my thing.) 3rd star because they are open 24 hrs and walkable from the palazzo
Insane that they are open 24 hours. Bonus: food is awesome. I am definitely coming back.

If you are craving Indian, there are unfortunately not too many options on The Strip.

This place is located in the food court at The Venetian (where Johnny Rockets and Panda Express can be found as well). Don't expect any fine dining, it's similar to a fast food dining experience. 

The guy who took our order was extremely confusing and confused. He asked us four times what drinks we wanted, then forgot to give us the drinks and once we had them, wanted to give them to us again. Not sure what was going on there but it was weird. 

The food was worth it though. It tasted fresh and flavorful. We tried the Pav Bhaji and the Shahi Paneer, both were yummy.
Not bad when comparing with food courts on the strip.. Much better than the Indian Masal grill food court on the Strip...
